children.name: align
children.description: The horizontal alignment of the title. Can be one of "left", "center" and "right".

children.name: floating
children.description: When the title is floating, the plot area will not move to make space for it.

children.name: margin
children.description: The margin between the title and the plot area, or if a subtitle is present, the margin between the subtitle and the plot area.

children.name: style
children.description:
CSS styles for the title. Use this for font styling, but use align, x and y for text alignment.

In styled mode, the title style is given in the .highcharts-title class.

children.name: text
children.description: The title of the chart. To disable the title, set the text to undefined.

children.name: useHTML
children.description: Whether to use HTML to render the text.

children.name: verticalAlign
children.description: The vertical alignment of the title. Can be one of "top", "middle" and "bottom". When a value is given, the title behaves as if floating were true.

children.name: widthAdjust
children.description: Adjustment made to the title width, normally to reserve space for the exporting burger menu.

children.name: x
children.description: The x position of the title relative to the alignment within chart.spacingLeft and chart.spacingRight.

children.name: y
children.description: The y position of the title relative to the alignment within chart.spacingTop and chart.spacingBottom. By default it depends on the font size.
